channel.title: Help wearing an item?
channel.description: I can't get it into a certain spot, it's a helm and when i click wield it goes to my right hand weapon slot..

item.title: Help wearing an item?
item.dc:creator: @I_Yaa_I I Yaa I
item.description:
@I_Yaa_I wrote:

Okay, well open up item.java and you shoul see something like this:

[code]// a collection of item methods
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.IOException;

public class Item {

public static int amulets[] = {4035,6577, 10519, 10413, 11204, 11205, 1120611146,
		11147, 11148, 11149, 11150, 11151, 11152, 11141, 6857, 6859, 6861,
		6863, 1724, 1718, 6585, 86, 774, 87, 295, 421, 552, 589, 1478,
		1692, 1694, 1696, 1698, 1700, 1702, 1704, 1706, 1708, 1710, 1712,
		1725, 1727, 1729, 1731, 4021, 4081, 4250, 4677, 6040, 6041, 6208,
		11274, 11275, 11276, 11273, 11941 };[/code]

If you wanted to add an amulet that goes into weapons place, take a look at the public static int amulets

public static int amulets[] = {4035,

Say your Amulet of Fury went into the wrong place, then you would want to put the id infront of the first id like this:

public static int amulets[] = {6585,4035,

This is the same with a plate helm full helm ect.

Don’t forget the commas either

Read full topic
